TopicTitle: Is there a place in game that keeps track of passive milestones.

Articles.Content:
Heya peeps, you may have noted that the game has a set of passive milestones that give rewards automatically as they are achieved regardless of what contracts etc etc are selected.

Id like to ask if there is any part of the game user interface that keeps track of what has or has not already been achieved in game?

ah, and thats the easiest way to access the information I take it?

Il leave the question open for a short time hoping for a game UI answer but this question might have to be marked as answered.

Have some rep
I know of no other place to access that information either. I thought there might be a way in the R&D centre or in Mission Control, but I couldn't find any.

It's there.

Up in the top right corner of the flight view, where there's that vertical stack of square buttons for viewing completed contracts. You know the one I mean: it's the one you can't see because it's so useless that your eyeballs have been trained to ignore it. Anyway, at the bottom of that stack is a new blue button with a globe icon on it. Click that.

Edited November 12, 2015 by Snark

Yes, the achieved info will be in the message center. Once you have discarded those messages, the only place to find the info is in the save. There isn't an in-game interface.

Cheers,

-Claw

If you never discard the blue achievement icon (as in, never click on the trash can icon when it is open), then it will keep a running tally of all your milestones.

Of course, the message window is terrible, you can't even move it, but at least it's something...
